11.A.1.Procedure: Legitimate user Bob clicked and executed malicious VBScript (autoupdate.vbs) on 10.0.1.5 (CodeRed)

DetectionCategories.Telemetry, Tainted: Telemetry showed wscript.exe (executing autoupdate.vbs) then spawning powershell.exe. The telemetry was tainted by a trace detection on wscript.exe.

DetectionCategories.Specific Behavior: A Specific Behavior alert was generated for the VBScript interpreter launching a suspicious PowerShell process. The alert was tagged with the correct ATT&CK Tactics (Defense Evasion, Execution) and Techniques (Scripting, PowerShell).

A Specific Behavior alert was generated for PowerShell execution with a very long command line. The alert was tagged with correct ATT&CK Tactics (Defense Evasion, Execution) and Techniques (Scripting, PowerShell).

DetectionCategories.Enrichment: The capability enriched wscript.exe with the correct ATT&CK Tactics (Defense Evasion, Execution) and Techniques (Scripting, PowerShell) and a suspicious indicator that the VBScript interpreter was executed.
The capability enriched powershell.exe with the correct ATT&CK Tactic (Execution) and Techniques (PowerShell) and a suspicious indicator that a PowerShell command was executed.

DetectionCategories.Specific Behavior: A Specific Behavior alert was generated for PowerShell commands being executed from another process (wscript.exe). The alert was tagged with correct ATT&CK Tactic (Execution) and Techniques (PowerShell).

A Specific Behavior alert was generated for decoding and running encoded scripting sources from another process (wscript.exe). The alert was tagged with correct ATT&CK Tactic (Defense Evasion, Execution) and Techniques (PowerShell).

Screenshots.MC-11.A.1-1.png: Telemetry showing wscript.exe (executing autoupdate.vbs) then spawning powershell.exe (tainted by a parent alert on wscript.exe)
Screenshots.MC-11.A.1-5.png: Specific Behavior alerts and enrichments for wcript.exe and powershell.exe

1.A.1.Procedure: Previously executed batch file (pdfhelper.cmd) launched a DLL payload (update.dat) using Rundll32

DetectionCategories.Telemetry, Tainted: Telemetry showed cmd.exe executing update.dat via rundll32.exe. The telemetry was tainted by a trace detection on Resume Viewer.exe.

DetectionCategories.Specific Behavior: Specific Behavior alerts were generated based on suspicious indicators that a "Loaded non-DLL and non-CPL file with specified parameters via rundll32." The alerts were tagged with the correct ATT&CK Tactic (Defense Evasion, Execution) and Technique (Rundll32).

Screenshots.MC-1.A.1-5.png: Telemetry showing cmd.exe executing update.dat via rundll32.exe
Screenshots.MC-1.B.1-6.png: Process tree within trace detection showing rundll32.exe executing (tainted by a parent alert on Resume Viewer.exe)
Screenshots.MC-1.A.1-23.png: Specific Behavior alerts based on suspicious indicators that a "Loaded non-DLL and non-CPL file with specified parameters via rundll32." The alerts were tagged with the correct ATT&CK Tactic (Defense Evasion, Execution) and Technique (Rundll32)

1.B.1.Procedure: Previously executed batch file (pdfhelper.cmd) moved a separate batch file (autoupdate.bat) to the Startup folder
